title: 105_hr2421
content: The Military Selective Service Act is repealed. The Military Selective Service Act is repealed, and assets, contracts, property, and records held by the Selective Service System will be transferred to the Administrator of General Services. The Office of Selective Service Records will not be reestablished, and employees will be assisted in transferring to other positions in the executive branch. Conforming amendments will be made to Title 5 of the United States Code. The Military Selective Service Act is repealed, and assets, contracts, property, and records held by the Selective Service System will be transferred to the Administrator of General Services. The Office of Selective Service Records will not be reestablished, and employees will be assisted in transferring to other positions in the executive branch. Conforming amendments will be made to Title 5 of the United States Code. Additionally, amendments are made to the Immigration and Nationality Act, including the removal of specific references to the Selective Training and Service Act of 1940 and the Selective Service Act of 1948. Amendments are made to various sections of the United States Code, including the removal of specific references to the Selective Service System and the former Selective Service System. In Title 10, subsection (a) of section 513 is amended by removing a specific provision. Amendments are made to various sections of the United States Code, including the removal of specific references to the Selective Service System and the former Selective Service System. In Title 10, subsection (a) of section 513 is amended by removing a specific provision related to subsections (c), (d), and paragraph (7) in different sections. Amendments are made to various sections of the United States Code, including changes to eligibility criteria for military duty under the Military Selective Service Act. Amendments are made to sections 12104(a), 12208(a), and 12647 of the United States Code, removing references to the Military Selective Service Act. Amendments to section 12647 involve removing references to the Selective Service System. Amendments to various titles involve repealing sections, amending provisions, and redesignating subsections. Amendments to Title 37 and Title 42 of the United States Code involve striking out certain sections and sentences. Amendments to Title 37 and Title 42 of the United States Code involve changes to legal services for desertion from the Armed Forces, with an effective date 180 days after enactment.
